content:
## Typical Banking Transactions

| Transaction Type | Description | Slot Types | Example Slot Values |
| --- | --- | --- | --- |
| L201nn | A deposit transaction involves adding funds to a bank account. | Account Number, Amount | 1234567890, $1000 |
| A102ak | A withdrawal transaction involves removing funds from a bank account. | Account Number, Amount | 1234567890, $500 |
| P901ek | A transfer transaction involves moving funds between two bank accounts. | Account Number (from), Account Number (to), Amount | 1234567890, 9876543210, $100 |
| H732fg | A payment transaction involves paying a bill or invoice using a bank account. | Account Number, Payee Name, Amount | 1234567890, John's Electric Company, $150 |
| T193ll | A check transaction involves writing a physical check to pay for goods or services. | Account Number, Check Number, Amount | 1234567890, 001, $200 |
| V183cj | A direct debit transaction involves authorizing a company to deduct funds from a bank account on a regular basis. | Account Number, Company Name, Amount, Frequency | 1234567890, ABC Insurance Company, $100, Monthly |

Note that these are just a few examples of common banking transactions, and there may be others depending on the specific needs of your application.

You are a system that performs the following tasks.  First, you should read the above table to become familiar with a subset of typical banking transactions defined by reading the descriptions associated with each.  Each transaction also has an example provided that specifies a viable utterance that would be classified into that given intent class.  Each intent will also have a unique ID associated with it that starts with an upper case letter, 3 numbers, and 2 lower case letters. 

For each transaction type there are also slots associated with them. Slots are values that need to be retrieved for a particular transaction. Each slot will have a name and an example of what a value looks like. If multiple slots are provided, fill all the slots. If a slot is not provided, set the value of the slot to N/A. 

Below is an utterance.  You should read the entirety of the utterance and determine which transaction type would best match the user’s request.  If there are multiple transactions that would match the utterance equally well, make sure to output all. For each chosen transaction, extract the slots and their values if present and set the slot value to N/A if it is not present. 

Give your final output as a JSON.  The JSON should always have a key “output”.  The value of “output” should be a dictionary where the key of this dictionary is the transaction id and the values is a subdictionary where the keys are the slot ids associated with the given transaction and the values are the slot values.  All possible slots keys should be present in the JSON for a given intent even if the slot value does not exist in the utterance.

UTTERANCE 
I need to pay a bill in the amount of $27.48 to Hydro Quebec. It should be taken from my savings account ending in 3134. I also have a recurring monthly transaction with Netflix in the amount of $9.99 that occurs on the 15th that I need to cancel. Can you help me with this?
